text.title: Design
lines: I found a dimpled spider, fat and white,
On a white heal-all, holding up a moth
Like a white piece of rigid satin cloth—
Assorted characters of death and blight
Mixed ready to begin the morning right,
Like the ingredients of a witches’ broth—
A snow-drop spider, a flower like a froth,
And dead wings carried like a paper kite.
What had that flower to do with being white,
The wayside blue and innocent heal-all?
What brought the kindred spider to that height,
Then steered the white moth thither in the night?
What but design of darkness to appall?—
If design govern in a thing so small.

linesTA.ref: I found a dimpled spider, fat and white,

tooltips.content: Hmmm the speaker might be taking a walk and stumbled upon the spider?

linesTA.ref: On a white heal-all, holding up a moth
Like a white piece of rigid satin cloth—

tooltips.content: Third time he repeats 'white.' He emphasizes all three are white.

linesTA.ref: Assorted characters of death and blight

tooltips.content: Grimmer words here as well, the speaker seems frightened...

linesTA.ref: Mixed ready to begin the morning right,
Like the ingredients of a witches’ broth—

tooltips.content: Seems to imply something evil and twisted

linesTA.ref: A snow-drop spider, a flower like a froth,

tooltips.content: They seem stuck in his head... He keeps going over them. That happens to me sometimes when a thought is bugging me.

linesTA.ref: And dead wings carried like a paper kite.

tooltips.content: Here's the moth, flower, and spider compared again, but not so scary this time.

linesTA.ref: What had that flower to do with being white,

tooltips.content: Seems disturbed, as if wondering "how could this be possible?"

linesTA.ref: The wayside blue and innocent heal-all?

tooltips.content: The footnote said a heal-all flower is normally blue, makes it even more rare...

linesTA.ref: What brought the kindred spider to that height,

tooltips.content: The speaker's mind is calculating all the rare circumstances for this event to occur.

linesTA.ref: Then steered the white moth thither in the night?

tooltips.content: Something is coloring, steering, and arranging.

linesTA.ref: What but design of darkness to appall?—

tooltips.content: What else but darkness would design something like this? Then an em-dash, like the thought trails off.

linesTA.ref: If design govern in a thing so small.

tooltips.content: Here’s the title for emphasis, seems like this is the main problem of the poem...
Then he seems to kind of take it back. Says the scene is too small to count.
